title: Good Hope
detailsOfAchievement: Good Hope Foundation is a civil society organization established in 1996 (Registered under Indian Trust Act, Registration no. 228/96) that run by a team of development research professionals (Students of Gandhigram Rural University, Tamil Nadu, South India) from various inter-disciplines of Rural Development. Research and development intervention are the two core aspects of the organization. We take-up research studies on the current issues in the areas of social, economic, cultural and environment aspects and initiate action oriented projects based on the study results. We also enhance the capacities of individuals and grassroots level institutions working in the field of Rural Development through internship. We extend our consultancy services to other civil society organizations working in the areas of Women Development, Joint Forest Management and Information and Communication Technology for Development. Mission 1. To take up research studies on current social, economic, cultural and environmental issues to find out the causes and effects for initiating necessary development interventions 2. To foster and facilitate Peopleâ€™s Institutions to plan, implement, monitor and evaluate development interventions of poor, based on their felt needs and available local recourses 3. To work with and to influence the policies of the government and non-government organizations through development research and consultancy 4. To build the capacity of various actors in the field of Rural Development to better perform their role to achieve sustainable development 5. To provide development information to the needy through Information and Communication Technology to improve their quality of life and 6. To network with other organizations with similar stake in field of rural development.

title: GRAAMEEYA MAKKAL ABIVIRUDHI IYAKKAM
detailsOfAchievement: Graameeya Makkal Abivirudhi Iyakkam (GRAMEEYAM) having its Headquarters at D/No 6/72,Siruvani main road ALANDURAI P.O, Coimbatore -641101 and running 20-Bedded Hospitals, and Two Mobile Medical care Units have applied for grant-in-aid for the year 2010-2011. Their application for Grant-in-aid for their on-going schemes for the year 2010-2011 addressed to the Secretary to the Government of India, Ministry of Tribal Affairs has been submitted through this office on 01.07.2010 The institutions have been inspected and the notes of inspection is as follows: Graameeya Makkal Abivirudhi Iyakkam (GRAMEEYAM) is a registered organization rendering services mainly to the Primitive Tribal (Irular) Groups in the District in various fields like Health, Vocational Training like Tailoring, 20-Bedded Hospitals, and Two Mobile Medical care Units. The Grant-in-aid applied for by the Association for the year 2010-2011 is especially for the Health Services rendered by them. The audited accounts and Utilization certificate for the year 2009â€“2010 are enclosed herewith. Now, Graameeya Makkal Abivirudhi Iyakkam (GRAMEEYAM) has submitted proposals for the year 2010-2011 for release of grant of Rs. 73,14,318/- Activities: 20 -Bedded Hospital and Mobile Dispensaries OTHER PROGRAMMEESS OF 1. Vocational training for tribes Youth 2. SHG for tribes Women Though the association is involved in so many activities, they have applied for Grant-in-aid for maintenance of the Graameeya Makkal Abivirudhi Iyakkam (GRAMEEYAM) namely running the 20-Bedded Hospital and Mobile Dispensaries Units in Thondamuthur Block. 20-Bedded Hospital and Mobile Dispensaries All the above said schemes are functioning in the Thondamuthur block Coimbatore district. The Association is registered with Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India for receiving foreign contributions vide registration No.075850124. Annual returns in Form FC-3 were submitted to the Ministry of Home Affairs, New Delhi for the year 2009-2010. This hospital is located at Alandurai near tribal Settlement, which is 48 Kms away from Coimbatore Medical College Hospital. This hospital is well equipped with 20 Bedded Clinical Laboratory, ECG and in the scheme Mobile dispensaries is always visited about 30 tribal settlements.

detailsOfAchievement: Hindusthan Educational and Charitable Trust was founded in the year 1992 by the eminent Industrialist and Philanthropist, Shri T.S.R Khannaiyann. The Trust is being managed by the Secretary, Smt. Sarasuwathi Khannaiyann, Joint Secretary Smt. Priya Satish Prabu and Trustee Shri.K.Sakthivel Raja. Since its inception the Trust has involved itself in benevolent activities for inculcating quality education by promoting various types of Educational Institutions. Hindusthan College of Arts & Science pursues a philosophy of perpetual acquisition of knowledge. Apart from academic curriculum, equally important is the policy to provide value based education and to bring out the hidden potential in students that equip them to approach life with optimism. The main motive of the Hindusthan Trust is to serve the needy. The Trust adopts poor children and offers free education. It also offers assistance and guidance pertaining to higher studies. The Trust also helps them to earn a living. The Trust motivates the rankholders and toppers by providing financial assistance. Started in the year 1998 with 300 students and 4 departments with 20 faculty members, the college has grown from strength to strength. Now the college has 18 UG Programmes and 13 PG Programmes and 13 Research Programmes. The reason for its success in such a short time is the excellent location of the college, its proximity to the railway station, the bus stand and the airport. Moreover, the college has earned a sound reputation for producing 100 percent results in most of its programmes and 100 percent placements for the students. In a short span of 14 years, the college has been able to produce several rank holders including 1st rank at the Bharathiar University. The College places its emphasis on Academic excellence which is the main aim of the dedicated staff and students. Every year the college strives to achieve maximum number of university ranks. The Visual Communication programme offered by HICAS is crowned to be â€œ The Best â€œ among all colleges in Western Region by the Media. The NSS Volunteers work in close association with the various social organizations serving the society. The Youth Red Cross is actively engaged in blood donation programmes and various other social services for the up-liftment of the downtrodden. National Level Seminars like EXEMPLAR, CLUSTERS, HIFEAST, BIMBAM, BIO-SUMMIT, INFO-ICONS, ASTOUND, HI-COM, etc. are some of the frequent academic activities conducted to enhance the knowledge of the students. Inter Collegiate Programmes like HILARICAS is conducted every year to encourage the students in activities other than academics. Over 100 colleges across the state and other states used to participate and win prizes upto one lakh.

detailsOfAchievement: HOPE (HOPE ORGANIZATION FOR PEOPLE EMPOWERMENT), founded in 2017, is an NGO in India registered as a Public Charitable Trust and is based in Tiruchirappalli, Tamil Nadu. HOPE closely works with the vulnerable communities and empowers the socially marginalized by providing them livelihood linkages, imparting skills leading to employment, health and education facilities. The focus areas of HOPE are livelihoods, skill development, health and education, rights, urban governance, financial inclusion.
